publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.abstract: Collection includes: Manuscript correspondence with friends and relatives in Germany, in German, 1879-1901, with typescript translations by Carl F. Nitz; Miscellaneous photocopy and original newspaper clippings in German and English, speeches, and ephemera relating to the Portland Social Turn-verein, circa 1880, most with typescript translations by Nitz; Receipts. Heinrich Rüppel was a German immigrant to Portland, Oregon, a foreman at the Oregon Furniture Manufacturing Company, member of the Portland Social Turn-verein and a jewelry craftsman.

langmaterial.language: Much of the collection is in German. Translations included in collection.

bioghist.p: Heinrich Rüppel was a German immigrant to Portland, Oregon, a foreman at the Oregon Furniture Manufacturing Company, member of the Portland Social Turn-verein and a jewelry craftsman.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes: Manuscript correspondence with friends and relatives in Germany, in German, 1879-1901, with typescript translations by Carl F. Nitz; Miscellaneous photocopy and original newspaper clippings in German and English, speeches, and ephemera relating to the Portland Social Turn-verein, circa 1880, most with typescript translations by Nitz; Receipts.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may required seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Heinrich Rüppel Papers, Mss 2162, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
